question:
Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off straight up into the air. halfway across the lake, turn slightly to the left and fly over the road. just before the ord intersection, turn slightly towards the last building on the right in that block. at the optician billboard, turn to the left in the direction of 10 oclock and fly forward. fly over 2 blocks of buildings then go lower to the ground in between the and and ord blocks of buildings. land on the far side of the sidewalk. turn to the left in the direction of 9 oclock. fly forward. at the first intersection, stop and look down at the ground. look up at the sky and turn to the right in the direction of 3 oclock. fly over the trees and decrease altitude until reaching the bridge. at the trees, turn to the left in the direction of 7 oclock. fly over the trees and decrease altitude at the fountain. turn to the right in the direction of 3 oclock and fly over the trees and water.]. You move according to a series of movement instructions. What are you doing now?  
choose:  
A. I fly over buildings.  
B. I cross the water.  
C. I go to the chair between the buildings.  
D. I turn right at the building.  
E. I turn back.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: A; Reason: The sequence of images shows the agent flying over a series of buildings, which aligns with the instruction to "fly over 2 blocks of buildings." This is evident from the changing perspectives and positions relative to the buildings in the frames.
textgrad_result.evaluation:
Location: [(0, 17), (23, 32)]
Option: A
Reason: From the beginning of the video to 17 seconds, the agent is flying over buildings. From 23 seconds to 32 seconds, the agent is still flying over buildings. Therefore, the answer is A. I fly over buildings.
textgrad_result.final_answer: Option: A; Reason: The sequence of images shows the agent flying over a series of buildings, which aligns with the instruction to "fly over 2 blocks of buildings." This is evident from the changing perspectives and positions relative to the buildings in the frames.
